column1: 10/10 - Great job identifying the product design function as a suitable candidate for implementing scrum/sprint methodologies. Your explanation of how scrum/sprint could operate for this function is well thought out and detailed. Keep up the good work!

Rating: 10 pts

Comment: Good job on explaining the scrum/sprint methodology for the chosen business function. Just a bit more clarity would make it perfect. Keep up the good work!
7 pts: Good attempt at discussing the poor fit of kanban, but some vagueness in the explanation. Keep up the good work!

10 pts: Great job identifying the production function as a suitable area for implementing kanban methodologies. Your explanation of the possible columns and process steps is well thought out. Keep up the good work!

Rating: 8 pts

Comment: Good attempt at explaining kanban, but missing some significant explanatory content. Keep practicing and refining your explanations.

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit.

Comment: Good effort in explaining the scrum/sprint methodology, but the discussion on why it is a poor fit for the function could be more specific and clear. Keep up the good work!

5 pts - Selected bias is clearly relevant to this situation

Great job identifying confirmation bias as a potential issue in this decision-making process. Keep up the good work!
10 pts - Complete and correct definition. Great job explaining the confirmation bias and its potential impact on decision-making. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Complete and clear description of possible problem. Great job addressing the potential effects of confirmation bias and providing advice on how to avoid it. Keep up the good work!
10/10 - Great job in providing a clear and complete description of possible steps and actions for implementing agile methodologies at Mighty Jaxx. Keep up the good work!
